Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery dinos; white slip; exterior: part of lotus bud from an alternating lotus bud and lotus flower frieze; below, two narrow bands above frieze of black and brown crescents.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as Manchester II.D.12. Lemos places the sherd within the Grand Style but the Manchester sherd clearly shows that the dinos belongs to the Sphinx and Lion Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 284, no. 806, pl. IV)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 144, n. 105)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0031) (phase 2)
